content.description: There is a flake about halfway up on the left that sounds hollow but turned out to be pretty solid.  Four of us used it and it is in a key location of the climb.  Does not look like the top is accessible to TR.
content.protection: The 5 bolts are well spaced and the two anchors have chains that come down to a large single steel non-locking biner.
content.location: This is the leftmost of the 5 routes on this face.  The chains are easily seen at the top.  The pictures help with the lack of a good description.

content.description: A very easy line on the right-side of the back side of the crag.
content.protection: Bolts with Bi-Chrome Fixe Hangers to Fixe Ring Anchor.  Bolts/Anchors circa ~1999
content.location: Starts on the right side of the "wash side" of the crag.  Starts slightly uphill and follows a water groove/dihedral. Right side as in this photo ​https://www.mountainproject.com/photo/117029158/boulder-beach-wall-from-the-wash#Comment-117032287​​​

content.description: This is the route to the left of Gila Monster with anchors visible from belay.
content.protection: Anchors at top, ring on left, mussy hook on right

content.description: Five fine easy sport climbs and some top ropes all established by an unknown couple from Vegas in the late 90s.
